gurmukhi: jdurwie ko Awies pwie qRIXw sB Kylq rws ibKy ibiD AwCI ] ieMdR sBw ijh isMD suqw ijm Kyln ky ihq kwCn kwCI ]
transliteration: Jaduraae Ko Aais Paae Triyaa Sabh Khelat Raas Bikhe Bidh(i) Aachhee|| Indra Sabhaa Jih Sindh Soutaa Jim Khelan Ke Hit Kaadhhan Kaadhhee||
translation: Obeying Krishna, the king of Yadavas, all the women performed the amorous play nicely like the dancing heavenly damsels of the court of Indra;

gurmukhi: kY ieh ikMnHr kI duihqw ikDO nwgn kI ikDO hY ieh qwCI ] rws ibKY iem nwcq hY ijm kyl krY jl BIqr mwCI ]571]
transliteration: Kai Eh Kinnhar Kiduhitaa Kidhau Naagad Kikidhau Hai Eh Taachhee|| Raas Bikhai Mi Naachat Hai Jim Kel Darai Jal Bheetar Maachhee||571||
translation: They are just like the daughters of Kinnars and Nagas; they are all dancing in the amorous play like the fish moving in water.571.

gurmukhi: ijh fky muiK dyiK Ctw suB suMdr m`iDm lwgq joiq ssI hY ] Bauhn Bwie so Cwjq hY md nY mno qwn kmwn ksI hY ]
transliteration: Jih Ke Moukh(i) Dekh(i) Chhataa Soubh Soundar Maddhim Laagad Jot(i) Sasihai|| Bhauhan Bhaae So Chhaadat Hai Mad Nai Mano Taan Kamaan Kasihai||
translation: Seeing the beauty of these gopis, the light of the moon is looking dim; their eyebrows have tightened like the tightened bow of the god of love;

gurmukhi: qwhI ky Awnn suMdr qy sur rwgh kI sB BwNq bsI hY ] ijau mDu bIc PsY mKIAwN mq logn kI ieh BwNq PsI hY ]572]
transliteration: Taahi Ke Aanan Soundar Te Sur Raagad Kisabh Bhaant Basihai Jio Madhu Beech Phasai Makheeaan Mat Lohan Kieh Bhaant Phasimakheeaan Mai Logad Kieh Bhaant Phasihai||572||
translation: All the tunes abide in their mouths and the mind of the people has been entrapped in their speech like the flies in honey.572.

gurmukhi: iPir suMdr Awnn qy hir jU ibiD suMdr so iek qwn bjwXo ] sorT swrMg su`D mlHwr iblwvl kI sur BIqr gwXo ]
transliteration: Phir(i) Soundar Aanan Te Har(i) Joo Bidh(i) Soundar So Ik Taan Bajaayo|| Sorath Saaran Suddh Malhaar Bilaaval Kisur Bheetar Gadyo||
translation: Then Krishna played a beautiful tune with his comely mouth and sang the musical modes of Sorath, Sarang, Shuddh Malhar and Bilawal;

gurmukhi: so Apny sux sRaunn mY biRj gÍwrnIXw Aiq hI suKu pwXo ] moih rhY bn ky Kg Aau miRg rIJ rhY ijnhU suin pwXo ]573]
transliteration: So Apne Soun Sraounan Mai Brij Gvaarneeyaa At(i) Hisoukh(u) Paayo|| Moh(i) Rahai Ban Ke Khag Au Mrig Reejh Rahai Jin Hoo Soun(i) Paayo||573||
translation: Listening to them, the gopis of Braja obtained great satisfaction; the birds and also the deer listening to the pretty sound were fascinated and whosoever heard his Ragas (musical modes), got greatly pleased.573.

gurmukhi: qh gwvq gIq Bly hir jU kib sXwm khY kir Bwv CbY ] murlI juqu gÍwrin BIqr rwjq jXo miRgnI miRg bIc PbY ]
transliteration: Tah Gadvat Geet Bhale Har(i) Joo Kabi Syaam Kahikar(i) Bhaav Chhabai|| Murlijout(u) Gvaaran(i) Bheetar Raajat Jyo Mrigadimrig Heech Phabai||
translation: Krishna looks splendid in singing beautiful songs with charming emotions at that place; playing on his flute, he seems glorious amongst gopis like a deer among does;

gurmukhi: ijh ko sB logn mY jsu gwvq CUtq hY iqn qy n kbY ] iqn Kyln ko mn goipn ko iCn bIc lIXo Pun cor sbY ]574]
transliteration: Jih Ko Sabh Logad Mai Jas(u) Gadvat Chhodht Chhodhtat Hai Tin Te Na Kaba|| Tin Khelan Ko Man Gopin Ko Chhin Beech Leeyo Phoun Chor Sabai||574||
translation: He, who is praised by everyone, he can’t remain unattached with the people he has stolen the minds of the gopis in order to play with them.574.

gurmukhi: kib sXwm khY aupmw iqn kI ijn jobn rUp AnUp gihXo hY ] jw muK dyK AnMd bFXo ijh ko sun sRaunn Sok dihXo hY ]
transliteration: Kabi Syaam Kahai Oupmaa Tin Kijin Joban Roop Anoop Gadiyo Hai|| Jaa Moukh Dekh Anand Badhyo Jih Ko Soun Sraounan Shok Dahiyo Hai||
translation: The poet Shyam is appreciating him, whose beauty is unique; for having whose sight, the bliss increases and listening to whose speech, allsorts of sorrows come to an end;

gurmukhi: AwnMd kY biRKBwn suqw hir ky sMg jÍwb su AYs kihXo hY ] qw ky suin qRIXw moih rhI suin kY ijh kO hir rIJ rihXo hY ]575]
transliteration: Oonand Kai Brikhbhaan Soutaa Har(i) Ke San Jvaab Su Ais Kahiyo Hai|| Taa Ke Soun(i) Treeyaa Moh(i) Rahisoun(i) Kai Jih Kau Har(i) Reejh Rahiyo Hai||575||
translation: Radha, the daughter of Brish Bhan, in great joy, is conversing with Krishna an dlistening to her, the women are getting allured and Krishna is also getting pleased.575.
